abstract: Murder conviction of Ruddy Quezada, who served 24 years in prison for killing Jose Rosado in Brooklyn, is overturned when Dist Atty Kenneth P Thompson concedes his predecessor Charles J Hynes withheld key evidence in trial; Quezada is latest to have his conviction overturned as Thompson's office reviews dozens of convictions obtained by Hynes.
lead_paragraph: District Attorney Kenneth P. Thompson admitted that his office had concealed a material-witness order as Ruddy Quezada, who was released after 24 years, sought to have his conviction reversed.

headline.main: 1993 Murder Conviction Vacated; Brooklyn Prosecutor Says Evidence Was Withheld
headline.print_headline: Murder Conviction Vacated; Prosecutor Says Evidence Was Withheld

snippet: District Attorney Kenneth P. Thompson admitted that his office had concealed a material-witness order as Ruddy Quezada, who was released after 24 years, sought to have his conviction reversed.
